availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Daniel T. Buckner (Winchester, Clark County, Kentucky, bank clerk and captain)

body.p: Winchester, Clark County, Kentucky, bank clerk and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Aylett Hawes Buckner and Charlotte Buckner. Brother of Benjamin Forsythe Buckner. Bank clerk in Winchester in 1860. Mustered in as sergeant in the 20th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.), Co. A, on January 6, 1862. Promoted to sergeant major on March 17th, 1862. Promoted to 2nd lieutenant on June 1, 1862. Promoted to captain.

ab.bibl:
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 36, 912.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clark, District No. 2, p. X.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clark, Winchester, District No. 2, p. 76.
Find A Grave, "Capt Daniel Turney Buckner (1843-1889)," Memorial #96416521, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/96416521 (accessed March 24, 2020).
